me.waltster.Fantasy.listener

Class PlayerListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.waltster.Fantasy.listener.PlayerListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.bukkit.event.Listener

    public class PlayerListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.bukkit.event.Listener
    The Listener for all Player events (excluding class/race specific ones).
    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    walt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerListener(FantasyMain main)
      Create a new instance of PlayerListener.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onDeadMove(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerMoveEvent event)
      Handle a PlayerMoveEvent, specifically if the player needs revived.
      void onDeath(org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityDeathEvent event) 
      void onPlayerDeath(org.bukkit.event.entity.PlayerDeathEvent event)
      Handle a PlayerDeathEvent We use this to capture when a player dies and handle XP drop, sending them to the lobby, broadcasting messages, and setting up a timer to allow for revival.
      void onPlayerHurt(org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityDamageByEntityEvent event)
      Handle an EntityDamageByEntityEvent We use this to cancel any in-lobby violence, as well as any special damage that may happen between entities.
      void onPlayerInteract(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerInteractEvent event)
      Handle a PlayerInteractEvent (essentially any clicking event)
      void onPlayerJoin(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerJoinEvent event)
      Handle a player join event When a player joins we need to send them a welcome message then give them their items, then send them where they need to go.
      void onPlayerSelectRaceOrKit(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent event) 
      void onSoulboundInteract(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent event) 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • PlayerListener

        public PlayerListener(FantasyMain main)
        Create a new instance of PlayerListener. Only one is needed per plugin though.
        Parameters:
        main - The instance of this plugin.

    • Method Detail

      • onPlayerJoin

        public void onPlayerJoin(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerJoinEvent event)
        Handle a player join event When a player joins we need to send them a welcome message then give them their items, then send them where they need to go.
        Parameters:
        event - The PlayerJoinEvent passed by Spigot
